results.title: Grampa's sci-fi hits
results.creator_credit: Peter Zasuly, Bertram Siegelson and Amvest Video
results.brief_description: Grampa Munster, one of the most popular stars from the 60’s television series “The Munsters”, presents a selection of movie trailers from famous and less prominent science fictions films. Trailers featured include: Flash Gordon (1936), Flash Gordon’s trip to Mars (1938), Flash Gordon (1980), Godzilla (1956), Destroy all monsters (1968), King Kong (1933), Alien (1978), Barbarella (1968), Rocky Horror Picture Show (1975), Dr. Goldfoot and his girl bombs (1966), Buck Rogers (1978), Omega man (1971), Fahrenheit 451 (1966), The Blob (1958), 30 ft. bride of Candy Rock (1959), Village of the giants (1965), The Amazing colossal man (1957), Godzilla vs. Megalon (1976), Ghidra, the three headed monster (1964), Varan the unbelievable (1962), Reptilicus (1961), Atragon (1963), Creation of the humanoids (1962), Battle of the worlds (1961), Earth vs. the flying saucers (1956), This Island Earth (1954), The Day the Earth stood still (1951), and Lost world (1960).

results.title: Grampa's monster movies
results.creator_credit: Peter Zasuly, Bertram Siegelson and Amvest Video
results.brief_description: Grampa Munster leads the viewer through an exploration of classic monster movie trailers. Trailers featured include: House of Frankenstein (1944), House of Dracula (1945), Son of Dracula (1943), Dracula’s daughter (1936), Dracula (1931), The Invisible man returns (1940), The Invisible woman (1940), Invisible agent (1942), The Invisible ray (1936), Frankenstein (1931), Frankenstein meets the Wolf Man (1943), Bride of Frankenstein (1935), The ghost of Frankenstein (1942), Abbott and Costello meet Frankenstein (1948), Phantom of the opera (1943), The Climax (19??), The Werewolf of London (1935), The Mystery of Marie Roget (1942), Murders in the Rue Morgue (1932), Flesh and fantasy (1943), The Wolfman (1941), The Mummy (1932), The Mummy’s hand (1940), The Mummy’s curse (1944), The Black cat (1934), The Cat creeps (1946), Black Friday (1940), and Horror island (1941).

results.title: Grain elevator
results.creator_credit: Charles Konawal and Wayne Finucan Productions
results.brief_description: Basic film about the workings of an old family style grain mill, a one to two man operation. One hundred and fifty box cars per year of grain are provided from about 100 small farmers.

results.title: Graham Sutherland
results.creator_credit: John Read, John Elliot and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A films about distinguished English painter best known for his portraits of Somerset Maugham, Lord Beaverbrook and Sir Winston Churchill. Sutherland is, however, a landscape artist who treats his subjects in a highly personal and poetic manner, which goes beyond surface realism. Descriptive sequences were specially shot in Pembrokeshire and in the South of France to show landscapes which have influenced his painting. The film concludes with a personal statement by the artist about his approach to his work.

results.title: Graduate harvest
results.brief_description: Massey College, situated in Palmerston North, is an agricultural college attached to the university of New Zealand. Students, including many from other parts of the world, attend coursers in horticulture, fruit growing, cheese and butter making, dairying and the raising of sheep and pigs.

results.title: Grace of my heart
results.creator_credit: Allison Anders, Elliott Lewis Rose, Daniel Hassid, Ruth Charny, Universal Pictures, Gramercy Pictures and Cappa
results.brief_description: In “Grace of My Heart” Allison Anders has used a number of rock’n roll reference points, creating character pastiches of famed musicians, producers and industry types. None of the characters directly match up to their real life counterparts, but the similarities are clear. Broadly based on the life of Carol King, ” Grace of My Heart” tells the story of Denise Waverly (Illeana Douglas), who starts her career as a want to be singer from Philadelphia, and goes on to become a successful songwriter. The story traces the long journey of personal discovery she must go through to ultimately become all that she wants to be. The film sets itself among the corridors of the famed Brill Building during the doo-wop heyday of the late fifties all the way through Malibu’s psychedelic surfer scene of the late sixties. With period costuming and a wall-to-wall pop soundtrack featuring the likes of Elvis Costello, Burt Bacharach, Lesley Gore, Carole Bayer Sager, J Mascis and Sonic Youth. Also starring John Turturro as Denise’s mentor and record-producer, Eric Stoltz as husband number 1, and Matt Dillon as husband number 2.

results.title: Grace Kelly - the American Princess
results.brief_description: Grace Kelly became the most sought after actress of her time and an Academy Award winner at 24. Having mastered her craft and at the height of her career, she stunned the world by choosing to leave Hollywood and become Her Serene Highness, Princess Grace of Monaco. Her remarkable story is told through film clips, home movies and interviews with Jimmy Stewart, Alec Guinness, Stanley Kramer, Louis Jourdan and others. Rated: PG

results.title: Grace
results.brief_description: Returning from her adopted home in London, to attend the funeral of her sister, an Aboriginal woman finds herself isolated from both kin and culture. This emotionally mature and complex work moves beyond didactism and easily digestable polemics to suggest that cultural dislocation is written as much in the body, in language and the psyche as it is in economics and politics. By suggesting that the effects for the “stolen generation” were as destructive for inter-Aboriginal relationships as they were for black and white relations in this country, “Grace” is a devastating and confronting exploration of what it means to have been “stolen”.
